channel.title: Americans' hero poll
channel.description:
http://news.aol.com/article/american-hero/353807
It seems like in a poll of America's favorited heroes, voted by the citizens, have voted upon Obama over all.

item.title: Americans' hero poll
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:21, topic:265838”]But I’m talking about the bad definition of a hero. A hero is someone who saved a child from a burning flat. Firefighters are heroes. Soldiers who lay down on a grenade so only they die and save their squad are heroes. Someone who invented a machine isn’t a hero, but a genius. See the difference?

Of course there are heroes in the US, but you guys give credits to those who aren’t. For one, until now Obama is nothing more then nice talks and a pretty face. He didn’t come up with the rescue plans.

And saying that the founding fathers are heroes is dangerous too. It’s like saying Hitler was a hero (he was a convincing speaker, just like Obama). Killing a shitload of Natives isn’t heroic in my opinion.

(When I said that America doesn’t have any heroes in my previous post, I meant that there are none following your definition.)[/quote]
Abraham Lincoln pretty much freed the slaves from a life of… well slavery and abuse.

And back then, everyone killed everyone else for no reason, kings n shit y’no.

Read full topic

item.title: Americans' hero poll
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

But I’m talking about the bad definition of a hero. A hero is someone who saved a child from a burning flat. Firefighters are heroes. Soldiers who lay down on a grenade so only they die and save their squad are heroes. Someone who invented a machine isn’t a hero, but a genius. See the difference?

Of course there are heroes in the US, but you guys give credits to those who aren’t. For one, until now Obama is nothing more then nice talks and a pretty face. He didn’t come up with the rescue plans.

And saying that the founding fathers are heroes is dangerous too. It’s like saying Hitler was a hero (he was a convincing speaker, just like Obama). Killing a shitload of Natives isn’t heroic in my opinion.

(When I said that America doesn’t have any heroes in my previous post, I meant that there are none following your definition.)

Read full topic

item.title: Americans' hero poll
item.dc:creator: @Square Square
item.description:
@Square wrote:

[quote=“Cain_”][quote author=Frell link=topic=351014.msg2697441#msg2697441 date=1236379513]

“Heroes” and “US” only fits together when the sentence says “Heroes in the war against the US.”

I’m sorry but the US doesn’t have any heroes. Unless you think genocide against the Natives is heroic. Unless you think talking about change is heroic. Unless you think attacking a country over something that wasn’t there is heroic. Unless you think that being shot in the head is heroic.

Etc…

Your an idiot.

You’re.

Dammit. I don’t usually screw up the your’s.

Anyway, the majority of the posts that are against the US are ignorant and are not specific. They just do it cause they can.

I’m not happy with the corruption and ignorance of their financial system.

Our government is fine to criticize, but when people usually just say ‘Americans are fucktards’ its ignorant.
[/quote]
I do agree, judging a whole group of people is wrong.[/quote]@ R.I.P
What you just said doesn’t make up all of America’s “heroes”.

Read full topic

item.title: Americans' hero poll
item.dc:creator: @jimmy0s Jimmy OS
item.description:
@jimmy0s wrote:

srt8:

These people are fucking nuts! Obama as a hero? He hasn’t done anything yet! And George W. Bush??? Omg…

It all depends on your definition of hero. A hero can just be someone you look up to, someone who fights for a cause, or even someone legendary. I can see why Obama was at the top; Almost everyone is unhappy with how the economy is in America and he promises and inspires change. I’m for Obama, and he sounds like the real deal, but you can never be too cautious.

Read full topic

item.title: Americans' hero poll
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:13, topic:265838”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=351014.msg2696808#msg2696808 date=1236334794]

“Heroes” and “US” only fits together when the sentence says “Heroes in the war against the US.”

I’m sorry but the US doesn’t have any heroes. Unless you think genocide against the Natives is heroic. Unless you think talking about change is heroic. Unless you think attacking a country over something that wasn’t there is heroic. Unless you think that being shot in the head is heroic.

Etc…

I can’t honestly say that during these times I’m proud to be an United States citizen but you seem to only look at the feats and none of the accomplishments.
[/quote]

Well, show me some accomplishments then?[/quote]

en.wikipedia.org

Eli Whitney

Eli Whitney (December 8, 1765 – January 8, 1825) was an American inventor best known for inventing the cotton gin. This was one of the key inventions of the Industrial Revolution and shaped the economy of the Antebellum South. Whitney's invention made upland short cotton into a profitable crop, which strengthened the economic foundation of slavery in the United States. Despite the social and economic impact of his invention, Whitney lost many profits in legal battles over patent infringemen...


http://www.150.si.edu/150trav/remember/r819.htm
http://www.150.si.edu/150trav/remember/r822.htm

Read full topic
